awd_titl_txt: Structural Geomorphology of the Pacific-Antarctic EPR
awd_abstract_narration: A field program will use Seabeam and SEAMARC                               II simultaneously for investigating the section of the East                     Pacific Rise along the Pacific-Antartic plate bondary. A                        principal objective is to determine how the characteristic                      structures of normal and oblique fracture zones are created at                  offsets of the rise-crest. The northern part of the                             Pacific.Antarcitc plate boundary is well suited for such a study,               because it is the best modern, active analog to the Tertiary                    Pacifc-Kula and Pacific-Farallon spreading centers, where the                   well known North Pacific fracture zones were created. Sparse                    magnetic data from the rise flanks and the obliqity of the                      overall trend of the ridge crest to the spreading-normal                        direction suggest that it has small, migrating nontransform                     offsets, as well as a set of typical transform faults. Another                  aim of the porposed cruise is to establish the style of plan and                profile segmentation of this poorly known accreting boundary.

inst.inst_name: University of California-San Diego Scripps Inst of Oceanography
